intro: Ainsliaea polystachya, commonly known as the golden flame or Mexican flame vine, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It is characterized by its striking, orange-red bracts that resemble petals, which are actually modified leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in panicles, adding to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in warm, sunny environments and is often cultivated for its vibrant foliage. Ainsliaea polystachya is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants.
